inn1.comm: on middle, turned to the leg side but Mills has started with a no-ball, as he did at Durham, and it's a free-hit
he can't really cash in, back of a length and forced up to mid-off
comes half forward to a ball on middle, defended to mid-on
turned off his pads towards the gap at square leg
gets behind the line and defends
touch too straight and Bell works it off the hip down to fine leg...not the best of starts by Mills
better line and length outside off stump, Bell lets it go through, decent carry to McCullum
good line outside off stump, hint of movement back off the seam as Wright leaves alone
back of a length, Wright tries to drive but gets a think inside edge into the leg side
pitched up fuller on off stump, a punchy drive from Wright but he picks out mid-off...where Vettori makes a good stop with his left hand
short and outside off stump, Wright lets it go through to McCullum
flashes outside off stump, hint of swing from Gillespie who has worked up good pace and Wright was flat-footed
on off stump, defended down to backward point, an excellent opening over from Gillespie as he kept Wright on his toes
back of a length, Bell goes across his stumps and takes a step towards the bowler before defending down the pitch
well bowled, keeping Bell in his crease as he defends at the top of the bounce into the leg side
touch fuller on off stump, Bell works up to mid-on
beaten by a good one outside off, or maybe Bell played inside the line, it's a 50-50 call. Regardless, it was nicely bowled by Mills
taken off middle and flicked through square leg, but there's a deep square-leg in place so he only gets one for a well-timed shot
short outside off, Wright goes up and over gully, bounces towards third man where Tim Southee makes a mess of the fielding and gives away a lazy second run...Mills a very grumpy man after that
nicely guided between point and cover, good timing off the back foot and he picks up a couple
another no-ball, this time from Gillespie, as Bell defends down to mid-off...free hit time again
this time he takes advantage, backs away outside leg and carves this high over deep cover for a mighty six...and it's another no-ball, the free-hit is carried over
well bowled this time, full outside off and Bell misses as he gives himself room again
defended square on the off side
pushed into the covers, Gillespie back on a good length and keeping his foot behind the line
defended into the off side
on off stump, pushed down to mid-off, a better finish to the over
on off stump, Wright being given a chance to free his arms, defends to the off side
outside off, driven hard into the covers but straight to the fielder...plenty of bottom hand in that stroke
angled out to backward point this time, you get the feeling that Wright starts to feel the pressure quite quickly as the dot balls add up
defended firmly down to mid-on
flicked in the air wide of mid-on, not enough legs to reach the rope but it's brace for Wright
loses his line down the leg side, it's been a mixed start from New Zealand
chopped down to third man from outside off stump, he keeps the strike
that's a very ugly heave from Wright, tries to launch this down the ground but gets a thick outside edge, one bounce, down to third man
a better shot this time, drives off the back foot down to third man...Wright needs to learn to keep his head against tight bowling
very elegant from Bell, an effortless force off the back foot finds the gap at cover and races over the practice wickets for a boundary...that's Bell at his best
flicks through the leg side this time, taken from middle and off, past midwicket for another two...good over for England
well timed off the back foot again, but this time straight at the cover fielder
outside off, hint of swing away, left alone
lofted straight down the ground, not quite timed and Vettori pulls it up just short of the rope...Wright is so much better when he plays straight
tight line on middle, defended back to the bowler
the bat twists in his hand, ball skewing just wide of short midwicket, as Wright gets away with another iffy stroke
off stump, defended back to Mills
walks right across outside off, and takes a step down the pitch, before driving straight at mid-on
outside off, forcing Bell to stay in his crease this time as he defends into the off side
banged in from Gillespie, Wright brings out another agricultural heave and doesn't get near making contact
fuller, tucked off the pads towards midwicket
hint of width outside off, Wright laces a cut shot but Oram pulls off a brilliant stop at gully...saved a certain boundary and keeps the pressure on Wright
no room for Wright to free his arms this time, pushed square on the off side
chopped into the off side, bounces out to cover
nicely played by Wright, comes across the crease and flicks it down to fine leg as Gillespie drifts a little too straight...but only by a little, was more good batting
comes across the stumps again, taken on the pad a lone appeal from Mills, wasn't actually a million miles away but Bell was a long way down and it was a touch high
tickled behind square on the leg side, a quick calls makes it a safe run
goes for the cut, goes very hard at the ball and loses his shape on the shot
hmm, Wright in a muddle here, this time charging Mills and trying to launch him straight...he lifted his head too early and it ended as an air shot

top catch...that was only a matter of time, short ball and Wright latches onto a pull but hits it straight at short midwicket where Ross Taylor holds onto a stinging catch...Wright will actually feel that's the best he's hit one today, but it was within Taylor's range and he pulled off a blinder
all defence first up from Pietersen, into the off side
on off stump, defended down the pitch at the top of the bounce
comes at the bowler again, flicked off the stumps and it races across the wide square towards the boundary...a good chase from Elliott who does superbly to haul it back in

gone! huge wicket for New Zealand, Pietersen falls for a duck as he goes for a pull but the ball wasn't as short as he thought and was wider outside off stump. he gets a big top edge which goes miles into the sky, Tim Southee steadies himself at mid-on and takes a good catch. New Zealand on top.
comes forward, gets a thick outside wide of second slip...the outfield is lightening quick and Bopara is away with a streaky boundary
full on off stump, well bowled, Bopara pushes into the leg side
pulls his length back, defended from off stump down the pitch...ends an over that brought a vital wicket for New Zealand
dropped into the leg side, good length on off stump
turned into the leg side, already some iffy calling between these two but no damage done
guided in the air down to third man, just one bounce to the fielder...almost timed too well by Bell
nicely turned off the pads, fine leg comes round to field as England bring up their fifty
outside off and left alone, good line, Bopara not tempted to play
inside edge into the leg side, big gap towards square leg for an easy single
beauty outside off stump, held its line and beat Bopara's outside edge
touch wider this time, easier leave for Bopara
comes forward, defended into the covers, good line from Gillespie
outside off, Bopara leaves well alone
drags his length a little shorter, Bopara decides not to have a dart at a ball he might have been able to cut...biding his time
tight outside off stump, Bopara defends to the off side, good over
well played, on leg stump and flicked past short fine-leg for a boundary to relieve some of the pressure
adjusts his line back outside off stump, Bell defends square to point
opens the face, but can't beat backward point
comes forward, guides towards backward point again where Oram pulls off another diving save...his hamstring his clearly fully healed now
strong cut shot, between point and cover and there was no stopping that over a rapid outfield
opens the face and beats Oram at backward point down to third man...productive over for Bell and England
starts well, outside off stump and the merest hint of some away swing, left alone by Bell
tucked out to short midwicket, Bell happy to use his feet to the quicker bowlers
fuller outside off, left alone by Bell
well placed between gully and point, barely touched and it sped away, Oram chases hard to keep it to two
outside off stump, defended back to Southee in his follow through
flicked in the air through the vacant square leg area, the man on the boundary means there's just a single
tight start, tucked out to midwicket
gorgeous shot from Bell, driven sweetly down the on side of the pitch and it raced down to the straight boundary...when he plays like that, Bell looks a million dollars
stays in his crease and turns this out to midwicket
outside off, typical one-day glide to third man
comes forward on off stump, Oram collects in his follow through
pushed into the covers, tidy end to the over
strays onto the hips and tucked through midwicket for a single
cut firmly but straight to point
driven hard back to the bowler who fields well and shies in his followthrough
good pressure on the fielder advancing from midwicket, and a cheeky single
outside off, and dabbed down to third man
full length and angling in. Bopara meets it with an arrow-straight blade, but mid-off fields with ease
hits the deck hard, showing no hangover from his hamstring injury just yet. Defended off the back foot to point
a smidgeon of width, and cut to third man
on a good length, driven hard into the covers, but no beating the field just yet
steered into the gully off the back foot, but fielded easily again
slower bat, Bopara waited well, met it with a whip of the wrists, and scampered a quick single to midwicket
short and slightly wide, but Bell can't get on top of his attempted uppercut, and jabs the ball down into the ground
on the hip, but Bopara can't connect with an attempted clip. Looks for the single anyway, but Bell's not interested
steered out to midwicket once again
a strangulated appeal as Bell shuffles across for a leg-side clip, but no interest from the umpire
stand and deliver - too short and wide, and Bell clobbers that in front of point, and pierces the field with ease

well well, he was looking so good, but Bell has gone! Good ball from Southee, genuine outswing and extra bounce as well. Bell was looking to run it through the slips but got the thinnest of nicks through to the keeper
back of a length, and Collingwood defends off the back foot in front of middle
calmly prodded into the off side
outside off stump, and Bopara has a nibble but doesn't connect
drawn onto the front foot for a textbook defence. Watchful stuff from Bopara at present
beats the infield this time with an open-faced drive through backward point
defended off the back foot, to complete another tidy over
clipped firmly off the toes, but straight to short midwicket. Bopara's not finding the gaps just yet
now that's pressure telling as Bopara hurtles through for a suicidal single. Not even his full-length dive would have saved him had Gillespie's shy from mid-on hit the stumps
the skipper shows how it's done. A lovely cover drive, all along the ground. Top shot
big stride, big defence. He's looking solid and determined
two steps down the track and a firm swish across the line, and Collingwood picks off a one-bounce four at deep midwicket. Excellent use of the feet, even if the shot ended up a little high on the bat
a more measured bat-and-pad defence to complete a successful over for England
slightly back of a length, and Bopara's uppish drive rolls straight to point
up onto the toes and Bopara drives with intent, but the shot takes the edge and lands perilously short of gully. A mite chancy ...
a slight reprieve as Oram offers some width and Bopara takes the single
turned coolly into the leg-side and through they go. Good running turns one into two
defended off the back foot, in front of off stump
well, they all count. A bit of width and a loose slash, and Collingwood's under-edge flies clean through the unguarded fine leg for a welcome boundary. The keeper had no chance of cutting that off
drawn forward and defended
too straight, and Bopara gratefully clips this one off his hip and jogs an easy couple
bouncer, and that clangs clean off the helmet and flies down to third man for, incongruously, leg byes. "That's the first one he's middled all day," drolls Gnasher
no helmets this time, just solid willow
pushed into the covers off the front foot
that's a massive breakthrough, and very well bowled. Just a hint of movement off the seam, and Collingwood's limp steer through the slips turns into a massive inside-edge onto middle stump
a hint of tweak first up, pushed back onto the stumps
defended with soft hands in front of middle
turned into the gap, and an instant call
a big stride and a smothering angled-bat defence
good bowling, Shah is hurried by that one, but his defence - in the end - is immaculate
drawn forward again, and defended again. A good first over
cracking delivery, drifted in with the arm, and somehow beat the outside edge of both bat and off stump. Explosive stuff
good drift again, and at high pace as well. Shah defends but shakes his heads perceptibly as he does so
Southee's got something going here. Shah drives/defends again, without a lot of conviction, and mid-off fields
straighter this time, but midwicket tidies up
a big stride, and defended into the covers
beaten outside off stump once again. That is a mighty fine over, and the pressure really is on England now
good use of the feet, and Bopara finds the gap at midwicket
slower ball, held back a touch and Shah deflects round the corner without beating the man at backward square
good variation in pace and flight, and nothing on offer whatsoever for England
drawn forward once again, same result
slower, and flightier, defended in front of middle
big stride, but same result. Another superb over
drawn forward and deflected into the leg-side. England dealing in binary at the moment
bouncer, and a good one. Shah ducks
bosh! Well, that was unexpected, but incredibly effective! A cross-batted mow, from a standing sweep position, and that clears midwicket by ten rows!
more circumspect this time. Solid defence
aiming through midwicket, but a leading edge picks up a single behind the bowler, who had no hope of pulling off a return catch incidentally
yorker length, well dug out
now it's Bopara's turn to use his feet, and very effectively. Three strides down the track, perfectly in position, and drilled over long-on
uses his feet again, but not quite to the pitch, so a solid defence ensues
pushed into the covers
turned for a single to end the over
driven out to midwicket
turned off the hips and finds the gap at midwicket
tip-and-run stuff, another single to midwicket
back of a length, and defended back down the pitch

ouch! Bopara swings into a pull shot, misses it entirely, and the ball gets wedged between his visor and grille. He plucks it out instantly, and doesn't seem too fussed by all that, but he's called for a new helmet nonetheless
that's the way to respond to a blow to the nut, slightly overpitched from Southee, and Bopara's clip whistles through wide long-on for his best boundary of the day
flat and full, Shah goes for the cut, but cuts straight to point
quicker delivery, and Shah is beaten outside off
Vettori holds this one back, and the ball is defended on off stump
good variation once again. Defended
outside off, and a whisky cut goes straight along the ground to gully. Lovely bowling again
drawn forward to defend, and that's a very tidy maiden
drawn forward into a defensive push, a hint of in-drift with the ageing ball
a good stride and a measured push into space in the covers
dabbed into the off side and good communication picks up a comfortable single as the underarm shy comes in from the covers
sweetly struck, and Bopara is really coming into his own now. His timing is beginning to shine through, and that cover drive sizzles to the boundary
defended off the back foot, and a loud "no!" as Ross Taylor swoops from the covers
a stride, a push and a single to long-on, and England are starting to regroup nicely
quicker ball outside off stump, chopped away to backward point
punched down to long on
loses his line down the leg side
eased down the ground to long-on, simple from Bopara
punched down the pitch again, Vettori dives to his right to collect
choped down by McCullum's feet, runs behind him for a sharp single
tucked backward of square on the leg side, easy for England to tick along in that over
squares up Bopara a touch as he shapes to play to the leg side, the ball runs back towards Oram
comes back off the seam a little into the batsman, defended into the off side
opens the face and angled out to backward point
a waft from Bopara, the momentary lapse he is prone to, as he tries to flash this away to third man and misses
pushed to the left of cover, enough time for a quick single
well bowled, Shah tries to take a ball from way outside off into the leg side but gets a leading edge to the off
drifting into leg stump, flicked out to deep square-leg
driven firmly down the track, Vettori dives and parries in out towards midwicket
top shot, goes inside out over extra cover and lofts it all the way over a short-ish boundary for six
misses out on a sweep, the ball scurries underneath McCullum
waits in his crease, works into the gap at midwicket
driven on the up through cover, they think of a second but despite a small fumble decide against it
edged to third man through the vacant slip cordon...that's the benefit of batting later in a one-day innings
dropped out towards backward point, rotates the strike
pulled down a touch short, Shah plays a front-foot pull through midwicket...deep square-leg just gets round in time with the help of a dive
expansive back lift, defended into the covers
driven down to long-on...James Marshall on as a sub
same again down to long-on...a carbon copy to end the over
starts on leg stump, flicked out to deep square-leg
drifts down the leg side again, given wide this time...actually clipped the thigh so he's unlucky
played square on the off side
driven down to a deep-ish mid-off
turned out to midwicket, can't find the gap this time
poor ball, lovely shot...outside leg stump and flicked away to the deep square-leg boundary to bring up Bopara's half-century off 70 balls
defended down the pitch
opens the face square on the off side
pushed into the covers
another quality shot from Bopara, eased on the up through the covers with a slightly open face and it races to the boundary...he's growing in confidence
placed through the covers, out to the deep fielder
hint of width outside off, angled away down to third man
taken from outside off stump into the leg side, but doesn't beat the infield
eased down the ground to long-on
taken off the pads down to long leg
again long-on is in action as Shah pushes down the ground
placed through the covers as the singles keep coming
more tip-and-run from Shah, played out square on the off side
picks out extra cover on the bounce this time
bowls from wide of the crease, pushed just wide of cover and time for a single

gone, and what a disappointing way to go after playing so well as Bopara chips a catch to mid-on. Looks as though it was a slower ball and he played too early, credit to the bowler there. End of a nice innings from Bopara at a crucial time
worked from middle stump to midwicket
flicked nicely through square leg, well timed but long leg manages to come on the boundary edge
driven firmly along the ground to mid-on...that's what Bopara probably wanted to do
opens the face and finds a gap at cover to retain the strike
flicked past midwicket, along the ground and placed well enough to allow Shah back for a second
does a little shimmy in the crease, ends up just pushing back to Vettori
gives himself a touch of room outside leg, slices out to deep cover
nicely bowled, flight on middle and off, Ambrose comes forward with bat and pad together
driven square through the off side, angled the bat with strong wrists
touch short outside off, cut away out to deep cover
great shot from Shah, goes high and handsome over mid-off who is inside the circle...one bounce and over the rope
this time he flicks superbly through midwicket, Shah at his best with a whip of the wrists as Gillespie corrects his line too much
pressure on Gillespie now, fires this one wide down the leg side
corrects his line, defend into the covers
straight down the ground this time, in the air but high and wide of Gillespie...he couldn't have hit that much straighter and long-on had no chance
good reply, banged in outside off stump, climbs over Shah's top edge as he had a half-hearted prod at the ball
on off stump, defended back to Gillespie, but a good over for England with 13 off it, the best of the innings
placed into the off side, gives Shah the strike back
turned through midwicket, superbly placed by Shah and excellent running to pick up a second against the deep-set field
dropped square on the off side, brings up his fifty off 63 balls...a vital innings for England
takes the pad into the leg side
pushed square on the off side, can't beat point
dragged down a touch short, cut away hard to deep point
hits the pitch hard on a good length, Ambrose defends into the off side
drive on the up but straight at extra cover
flicked from off stump into the on side
gone, big wicket and another failure for Ambrose as he picks out deep square-leg with a pull that he never tried to keep down, but didn't hit it hard enough for a six, either
outside leg stump, flicked down to fine leg and there's a chance to come back for a couple
defended out to backward point
opens the face and just beats a diving backward point as Swann gets going
takes a thick outside edge down to third man
tough chance as Swann flays a thick outside edge down to third man, it just about carries to Gillespie who dives forward but can't quite hold on...harsh to call that a drop
low full toss outside off, expertly placed through extra cover, and although it was only a few metres away from Daniel Flynn he couldn't stop it
another, bigger, full toss and all Shah can do is bunt this one down the ground
driven firmly down to mid-off
opens the face very late, finds space at cover as he plays a punchy drive
beaten outside off as he tries to run it down to third man
finds the middle this time, but can't get it past backward point...important for Swann to rotate the strike
driven down to long-on, a couple of bounces to the fielder
homing in on leg stump, flicked out through midwicket with good timing
pushed through the covers out to the sweeper, again good placement allows time for a couple
gone, another lazy shot from an England batsman as Swann picks out the squarer of two backward point fielders...a limp effort from Swann when Shah needed some support
on middle, pushed into the leg side
outside off, a flat-footed drive from Broad which doesn't connect
beaten again outside off, trying to force off the back foot this time
forced into the off side, one bounce to cover
slashes away down to third man, New Zealand won't mind that as it means Broad keeps the strike

big wicket, and a superb piece of fielding from Gillespie. Nicely punched off the back foot, through the covers and Broad comes back for a second...but there's a superb throw from the deep by Gillespie which catches Shah a couple of inches short at the non-striker's end, brilliant piece of work a huge wicket
cut away square through the covers
opens the face and collects a run to backward point
slashes away again through the covers, the sweep keeps them to a single
on the stumps, played firmly out to backward point
wow, where did that come from, Sidebottom lofts straight back over Oram's head...long-on keeps the ball inside the boundary, expansive from the No. 10
beaten outside off stump as he goes for a square drive
driven strongly square through the off side, but they can only get one, New Zealand won't mind the singles
well-directed bouncer from Southee, over middle and off and Sidebottom ducks at the last minute...Southee is a clever bowler
banged in outside off, Sidebottom goes for a square slash and misses...more dot balls for New Zealand
would have been gone with a direct hit, dropped out to backward point and Sidebottom sprints off for a hopeless single but Jamie How's throw misses despite plenty of time to take aim
gone this time, Broad is the latest to somewhat give his wicket away as he slices his drive to backward point...How makes no mistake this time and England fall away further.
thick inside edge into the leg side, confusion everywhere as Sidebottom sets off for a single but Anderson is going nowhere
runs off the outside to the right of backward point, easy run this time
round the wicket, turned from off stump out to deep square-leg...huge shout of 'No' from Sidebottom as Anderson wanted a second which wasn't on offer
low full toss, driven down to long off
bouncer wide of leg stump, a poor wasted delivery
turned off the hip to deep square, Sidebottom again takes control of the calling
round the wicket, beaten outside off as he goes for a cut
beaten outside off, a flat-footed poke from Anderson
and again, good line going across Anderson outside off, he can't make contact
lucky for Anderson, uses his feet and gets an outside which flies right between the keeper and the wide slip...he couldn't have placed it better
good reply, short ball rising towards Anderson's throat, fended down by his feet
another wild short ball, way over Anderson's back...Southee just getting a little carried away
much better, beaten outside off again as Southee corrects his line
another edge between the keeper and slip, no luck for Southee but useful runs for Anderson
good yorker, jabbed square on the off side...the spin nearly makes a fool of How at point, but he recovers to make the save

backs and has a huge heave, squirts away into the leg side and it's a shambles in the running as neither batsman can decide if they want two...New Zealand shy at both ends, both batsman are safe and for all the effort it's one run,
pushed into the off side, Sidebottom dives to make his ground...Vettori does very well backing up
and the innings ends, excellent yorker jabbed into the covers...go for a single which was never on, the ball is lobbed back to Gillespie who calmly takes off the bails

inn2.comm: outside off, angled across the right hander, defended into the covers
on off stump this time, bending back into How, who nudges the ball to square leg
outside off, left well alone
jabbed down into the crease, slightly shorter length, but still ploughing that off-stump furrow
good wicket-to-wicket stuff, tucked away to midwicket again
down the track and a checked drive beats Sidebottom in his followthrough for the first run of the innings
sloppy from Wright at midwicket who lets a regulation clip through his hands, to allow McCullum onto strike for the first time this match ...
back of a length, but straight enough to keep McCullum honest. Defended back to the bowler with a little hop
short and fizzes through at a good height. Could have been called wide, but wasn't
a stride to the ball, and a clip into the leg-side
too short and wide, and How drills that on the up to the deep point boundary, where Bopara dives but can't rescue the situation
fuller and straighter, and solidly defended
outside off, angled across McCullum's bows, and left alone

wide, a swish, and that's massive. McCullum needn't have chased that, it was almost outside the tramlines, but chase it he did, and Swann at slip held a comfortable and crucial edge. That's a huge blow for New Zealand's hopes
swing outside off again, but this time the ball passes harmlessly by
a pre-meditated shuffle into position, and that's walloped, all along the ground and away through the covers. Top shot
a fine riposte from Sidebottom. Held his length back a fraction, and beat Taylor outside off
good bowling again, starting on middle and angling to off, Taylor edges along the ground to point
a stride down the pitch, and defended
hits the seam and zips back into How, who adjusts late to defend. Good ball
clipped off the hip and picked up at backward square
that's a lovely ball from Anderson, outside off from wide on the crease, holding its line, and just sneaking past the edge
fuller length, dug out to mid-on, and Taylor makes his ground well, so well in fact, that he poleaxes Pietersen with the peak of his helmet as the pair converge at the stumps
full length again, clipped to midwicket
way outside off stump
a drive and a miss, beaten by the angle that time - he was playing for non-existent swing and nearly got the edge
another cracking delivery - shorter in length, but still as straight as an arrow
outside off, and beaten again. This is a good over
a fraction wider, and this time there's no stroke offered
outside off once again, good constrictive line and length
a fine delivery to end the over, just climbing outside off, and takes the splice to be picked up in the gully.
full, straight and fast. Excellent bowling again, and a hasty defence ensues
onto the back foot and driven hard into the covers, but only as far as Bell at short cover
full length again and driven back to the bowler, who parries in his followthrough. A nice shot for none
cracked for four! Super shot - smacking it off the back foot
just short of a length, it's neatly flicked to leg with a shimmy down the pitch and they pick up two
very good line on the off stump, How clamps down on it off the back foot. Solidly defended there
dropped down to leg and they steal a quick single. Cheeky, cheeky

oh dear. A super catch from Broad but a wretched shot from Taylor, trying to whack Sidebottom into the deep midwicket stand but he's beaten by pace and can only sky it. Broad, at mid-on, steadies himself to take a comfortable catch
banged in short and wide, somehow gets away with it
dropped thick edge to second slip and Owais Shah puts down a simple catch at second slip...what a let off
outside off and left alone
probing line out side off, Styris lets it go through and Anderson continues to ponder the dropped catch
driven firmly down to mid-off
lovely shot, wide outside off and Styris lets his arms flow through ball as he races to deep cover
better line across the right hander, Styris leaves well alone, nice carry to Ambrose
testing line outside off stump, not as full as when he was driven, left alone again
pushed square on the off side, good running
on middle and off, pushed into the gap at midwicket off the back foot
outside off, going across and left alone
good line outside off, How watches closely and lets it go...he's playing within himself so far
outside off stump, defended firmly into the covers
outside off, again How not interested in playing...clearly trying to see off the new ball threat now that two wickets have gone down
dragged down short and wide, crashed into the covers where Ian Bell saves a certain boundary...good back-up for the bowler
pushed into the gap between cover and mid-off...Styris seems to timing it well so far
well bowled, comes back into How who defends back to Anderson
top shot, driven dismissively on the up wide of mid-off...doesn't come much better than that
goes again, squarer this time through point and Shah becomes increasingly nervous after his drop catch
responds with a bouncer over off stump, Styris sways out of the line
pushed down towards mid-off, sharp single as the fielder is slightly on his heels
down the leg side, poor ball from Sidebottom and it's clipped down to fine leg...expensive over
outside off, going across How and left alone
starts with a bouncer, over middle stump, and Styris goes underneath it
defended from middle into the leg side
another screaming cover drive, hint of width and a touch full, laced through the covers
drags this one wide, and so wide it's called...England losing their way
better line, on middle and off, defended back down the pitch
on off stump, goes back and across to defend into the covers
ends as he started, with a bouncer, which Ambrose palms down into the ground...close to another wide
goes way outside off stump and works this into the huge open spaces on the leg side
short, wide and hammered...Sidebottom gives Styris something to latch onto and he puts it away wide of third man
more width, but this time Styris misses out as he loses shape on his cut
top shot through the covers, just leant on it outside off stump and pierces the gap between mid-off and cover. Doesn't quite have the legs for a boundary as Pietersen pulls it in
defended from off stump down to mid-off
whipped from middle stump, straight at mid-on but How is quick enough to complete the single
strays down the leg side, and rightly called
better ball, just short of a length, and defended off the back foot to cover
attempted yorker and a good one too, well dug out and fielded at mid-on
drawn forward and defended at the crease
short, might have been called wide had How left it alone, but he fetched it from above his head and pulled into space at midwicket
angling in, lovely shape on that ball, and a half-appeal is strangled as Anderson realises that there was a bit of bat on that
drawn forward to complete a good over from Anderson.
clipped out to deep square leg, using the pace on the ball
back of a length and angling in from outside off stump, steered to point
dropped - a bit of width from Broad, a loose slash from Styris, and though he got both hands to the ball in a goalkeeper dive to his left, the chance burst through his fingers
straighter. Nudged to midwicket
banged in and How climbs into a swivel-pull, but misses out as the ball thuds into his midriff
clipped out to deep midwicket
width, and slashed hard, but Collingwood this time clings on with his dive at point. It's a bump ball though
driven into the covers
full length, outside off stump, and beaten
pushed into the covers, and an easy single
shorter in length, but pretty straight, as Styris sways out of line
pushed onto the back foot, as cover fields
that was, for about two-and-a-half seconds, a very suicidal single. But then Graeme Swann, at mid-on, fumbled his pick-up, and that was the end of that
dropped - driven hard, back at the bowler, but straight into his midriff, who reacted late, and the chance goes begging. The third chance of Styris's innings
banged in, more venom in that, and it comes off the splice but lands safe
that's a better shot, right to the pitch and rifled through the covers. Lovely strike
clipped into the leg side. England are starting to regret their lapses now
down the track and nurdled into the leg side
not a good start. Fine leg is in the circle, so a leg-stump long-hop is easy pickings for How
better bowling, dragged a touch short, but much straighter
a big stride, and defended. This is a better line and length
pushed back onto the stumps, and defended back down the pitch
forward in a defensive press, and fielded in the covers. Quick calling
a good end to the over, short but straight, and defended in front of off stump
short but doesn't get up much. No matter, How rolls his wrists and times it well out to deep midwicket
stands tall in the crease and pushes into the covers
width outside off stump, and Styris climbs into an expansive drive, but point swoops to intercept
steered out to gully off the back foot
banged in and fended down to third man as Styris gets up onto his toes
slower ball, dead-batted to cover, and a good quick single is called
good line and length, drawn forward and defended
a touch of tweak off the pitch, enough for the ball to be tickled round the corner for a single
good bowling again, outside off and shaping towards middle. Defended with a suspicion of a leading edge
guided to midwicket
a big stride, and picked up at midwicket
excellent bowling, and that's a vital breakthrough for England. How strides forward, and succeeds only in chipping the ball straight back to Swann, who flings it away with glee
pushed back onto the stumps, and defended
short, and fizzes through as Styris sways out of line. Not quite a wide, but that is Broad's one bouncer for the over
down the leg side
short and deflected off the splice into the leg-side. Good aggression from Broad, but Styris might have picked up two but for a slip at the non-striker's end
too straight to the left-hander, and clipped into the deep
a swish and a miss, that's a loose stroke from Flynn. You wouldn't chase that in a Test let alone an ODI run-chase
straighter and fuller, and defended to point
good turn from middle to leg, and some smart fielding at backward square prevents the single
shaping to hit into the leg-side but doesn't find the gap
another big stride, and this time Styris finds the gap on the leg-side
a big appeal and that's not a million miles away. Hit in line and might have drifted past leg ... at a pinch
bat-padded away to the off side
back onto the stumps, and driven back to the bowler
banged into the hips, and flicked behind square. Looking for two, but thinks the better of it
short, and slightly leg-sided, but Broad gets away with it
Flynn plays a patient game as Broad keeps his options tight
good bowling, cramping the left-hander for room
defended with soft hands, and a good quick single into the covers. Singles will do for now for New Zealand
too short, but Styris doesn't make the most of a bonus ball, and an indifferent pull dribbles out to deep square leg
outside off, driven to extra cover
turns from outside, flicked to midwicket
nice loop, on off stump and turned to midwicket again
turned off the stumps out to deep square-leg
nice shot from Flynn, worked through midwicket with good timing. Broad gives a long chase and flicks it back inside the boundary...good cricket all round
turned along the ground wide of midwicket, keeps the scoreboard ticking
chopped away down to third, hint of width allowed Styris to free his arms
gets a thick outside edge as he drives away from his body, flies between the slip and gully down to third man
cracking yorker from Anderson, homing in on middle and leg (and Styris' toes), well dug out at the last minute
driven out through the covers to the sweeper
back and across to defend, Flynn knows he needs to support Styris
great shot, dropped a touch, Flynn rocks back and plays a handsome pull in front of square...he likes the pull, despite his close encounters with an Anderson bouncer earlier in the tour
defended from outside off stump, back to Swann
flicked with strong wrists through midwicket, was taken from well outside off stump with the spin
nicely bowled, nearly brings another leading edge as Flynn plays a little early against a ball that bounces
dropped square on the off side, quick single was well judged
dropped into space for a quick single

gone! another big wicket for Swann as Flynn tries to sweep against the spin and gets a top edge, Ian Bell takes a simple catch at midwicket. The pressure told from a good spell by Swann, the match swings again
ooh, close to another wicket, as Styris upper-cuts down to third man and it lands just in front of Swann at third man. He's in the action everywhere at the moment, and did well to save the boundary
back of a length, dropped into the off side
flicked from middle and off to midwicket
good bouncer, over middle and leg, Oram sways out of the way. England tested him a lot in the Tests with the short ball
round the wicket, very full outside off and driven out to the cover sweeper
another scorching drive from Styris, picks the gap wide of mid-off...that's his fifty off 60 balls, a good innings considering how out of form he has been
well bowled again by Swann, Oram gets a leading edge towards mid-off and has to hurry as Sidebottom has a shy
hint of turn into the pads, Styris doesn't make contact
tucked out to short midwicket
flicked out along the ground to deep square-leg
defended from middle stump
down the leg, given as wides as it goes all the way to the boundary...Swann thinks it came off the pads
defended into the off side
on middle and flicked to midwicket
driven down to mid-off, think of a single but it's not on
goes for a pull, doesn't get it out of the middle and gets it wide of long leg
pushed from off stump out to the sweeper on the cover boundary
slow half-tracker from Collingwood, helped around the corner down to long leg
opens the face and runs it away down to fine leg
superb shot, fetched from outside off stump and swept hard to deep square-leg, no one got near stopping that...useful boundary
calmly driven down to long off, smart batting after the boundary to pick up the single...already five from the over
turned wide of midwicket
a repeat of the first ball sweep, connected very cleanly and beat deep square-leg even though he'd been moved round a little...momentum starts to change again
tossed up outside off, driven down to long off and an overthrow is given away because of a sloppy piece of work from the man backing up
tucked out to midwicket, 13 off the over
driven away square through point, Oram starting to take control and again Shah is beaten on the off side this time...he isn't the quickest in the field
on middle and leg, turned out to midwicket
excellent batting, dropped into the off side and an easy single...Oram looks in fine form
gets away with one into the pads as Styris clips straight at midwicket
dragged down short, hammered with a pull out to deep midwicket...that could have gone anywhere
flicked away expansively off the pads, just behind square and it's placed well enough for a couple
nearly strikes first ball as Styris flashes outside off stump, almost getting an edge
on leg stump, flicked down to fine leg
turned through midwicket
driven in the air down to long off, very safe
driven hard through the covers, but straight at the sweeper
excellent shot, guided away down to the short third-man boundary...another good over, New Zealand moving along nicely
poor start, on leg stump, tucked away down to fine leg and the fifty stand comes in  a little more than six overs
outside off, driven out to deep cover
wide outside off, cut away down to third man
short and pulled very hard out to deep square-leg, where Wright makes a good tumbling save
closer to Oram's body as he tries to force this away, picks out backward point
sweet on-drive from Oram, not quite out of the middle but has enough on it to beat a diving mid-on and the runs keep flowing
short and wide, hammered through the covers and straight at the sweeper
well, Oram really is flowing, as he steps away and smacks this straight at cover...that was going at some rate of knots, a foot either side and it was four
delicate this time, waited for it and guided down to third
punched off the back foot to cover
short and into the body, deflects down to long leg
well bowled, bouncer direct at Oram's head...he has to sway late out of the line
tucked off the pads out to deeps square-leg, placed well enough for two
bouncer outside leg stump, called wide as Ambrose takes it outside the stumps
pushed into the off side, Collingwood races in and fires a hard throw right at Anderson's backside...that's painful, although all Anderson's team-mates find it very funny
taken from middle, flicked out to the deep again, easily ticking along at the moment. England need to make something happen, and soon
dragged down short outside off stump, placed through backward point and a well-taken two...England's fielders have really been under pressure today, and often haven't been up to the task
well bowled and unlucky for Anderson, a short ball takes the shoulder of the bat and it loops safely into the off side, short of Collingwood running in

gone! what a moment, superb catch at deep square-leg as Oram top-edges a pull and Anderson strikes with his last ball. Alastair Cook, on as sub, took an excellent low, running in and Anderson was pumped
nudges into space to keep the scoreboard moving
dabbed into the off side, good length from Broad
shorter, and Elliott is onto his toes, defending into the covers

so close to a run-out! Styris dropped the ball into his crease, looked for the single but Elliott sent him back. In hurtled Broad to sidefoot at the stumps, but he just missed. It would have been touch and go
defended into the off side again
short, and defended uppishly - might have been a chance if the close catchers had been in, but it landed safely in the end
good line and length to start his new spell, and excellent work from Pietersen at gully prevents a single
a big stride and a firm drive, and Sidebottom tumbles at mid-off to field
short, and pulled flat, all the way to deep midwicket
half a step down the pitch and Collingwood saw him coming, and banged in a bouncer. Good bowling

defended with an angled bat, and that pierces the infield, but here's trouble. Superb throw from Swann at third man who sized up that the non-striker was struggling to make the second run, and Collingwood gathers brilliantly and swings round behind his back to remove the bails with Styris a yard short
pushed into the covers to complete an eventful over
a monstrous appeal, and it wasn't a very big stride from Vettori. Big enough to earn the benefit though
dabbed to short midwicket. Swann is round the wicket to the left-hander
brilliant ball, and massively unlucky. Wonderful flight, big bite out of the rough. Elliott was bamboozled as the ball flew over his middle stump, but so too was Ambrose
shorter in length, and another chance as Bopara fields at short square and shies. Swann gathers the throw, but Elliott is home
a big stride and pushed down the ground to mid-on
outside off, and swept aggressively, in front of square, but the man at orthodox midwicket fields on one knee to limit the damage
poor ball, a misdirected slower ball, on the pads and tickled fine
fuller length outside off, driven hard and half-fielded by Collingwood in his followthrough
tight line again, defended into the covers
slower ball offcutter, and it does the trick! Beautifully bowled but an even better catch by Bopara, leaping at short midwicket to intercept a lofted on-drive. Suddenly, England are back in the hunt
short and misdirected, and that's rightly called
short again, but outside off this time, and Mills draws his bat back inside the line
short again, Mills is pushed back onto his stumps, and that's the end of another important over for England
short and steered down to third man
good tweak, and clipped into the leg-side
turned to leg again, and a quick scamper to rotate the strike
flight and turn, solidly defended
looped up above the eyeline, and drilled firmly out to deep cover
clipped round the corner, and Bopara fields well to limit New Zealand to a single
too straight from Collingwood, and Elliott picks his man well. It's Owais Shah who chases out to deep midwicket, and an easy three
short again - nothing up to the bat for Mills in this innings so far, after the damage he caused at Bristol
short, and those are vital runs for Elliott, who doesn't need to rush his pull, just a gentle paddle round the corner. Good batting from Weybridge's finest
spectacular tumbling stop from Pietersen in the gully, and it needed to be as well  - that was runs otherwise
slower ball, another offcutter, but well read
driven nicely to Sidebottom at deep cover, but that's a better over for New Zealand's prospects
finds the gap on the off side again, and another useful single
perfectly measured steer through the vacant slip from Mills, Sidebottom chases well to stop the boundary
another deliberate edge, and this one flies quicker. Expensive over, and still three balls to come
tighter line, and worked into the leg side
top nurdling from Elliott, finds the gap at midwicket and an instant call for one
singles everywhere, this time to point, and Collingwood needs an urgent rethink
slashed down to third man
turned off the hip and another easy single. England are dying in a hole at the moment
short, but no venom in the delivery, an easy paddle-pull to deep square
wide of the crease and banged in short, good variation and a valuable dot ball
short again, Elliott looks to steer through the gully, but can't get the angle
a touch of width and Elliott flings the bat. He misses out, but New Zealand are still in command
slashed hard to deep point, good shot for little reward
tip and run, a quick call as the shy comes in from the covers
unconvincing from Mills, as he defends on the back foot and inside-edges to square leg, but another single

all hell breaks loose here. A massive mid-pitch collision between Elliott and Sidebottom, who was closing in on the ball but running straight at the batsman, and Elliott goes down clutching his thigh. England carry on and throw down the stumps at the non-striker's end, and after a long debate, he is given out.
good delivery from Sidebottom, short and straight
outside off stump, and Mills slashes in vain
back of a length, and dabbed down to third man
short, and pulled to excellent effect. New Zealand are still fighting for this match
pushed out to cover, and another single
outside off stump, and a missed nurdle
Broad and Southee collide this time, but to rather less dramatic effect
round the wicket, and nudged off the pads to deep midwicket
whipped off the hip, but no pace as the ball runs down to fine leg
open-faced drive out to backward point, and they think about a second run
right up in the blockhole, and clipped out to square leg
short of a length, and defended off the back foot to cover
good delivery to finish Sidebottom's spell, on leg and angling to middle
full length and driven back to the bowler, who feigns a return catch to fool the crowd
slower ball, pushed down to mid-off
firm stand-and-deliver slash, but short cover fields

that's a bit of a massive moment! A steer into the covers, a swoop from Bell, who pings down the stumps with two-and-a-half to aim at. Southee is six inches short, and England have a sniff, as Mark Gillespie comes in at No. 11
on leg stump, and clipped down to backward square. No second run this time ...
banged in short, and Mills has a swipe, but can't make contact. Nearly a wide, but not quite
good line and length, staunchly defended in front of off stump
looped up and Gillespie makes to have a swing, but opts against it in the end
dropped? We think... Ambrose can't gather a beautifully looping delivery
Gillespie is all at sea against this spin
looping, teasing, fascinatingly tantalising bowling. Gillespie is bamboozled but digs out a defensive stroke
forward again to smother the spin, and that's a fantastic maiden over. It's down to 12 from 12!
short, and Mills climbs into a swipe, but can't make contact. A valuable dot ...
slower ball, and Mills was gone for all money, but somehow the ball looped over the bails and he survives!
he's connected this time! A vast swipe over deep midwicket, and that's changed the equation!
much fuller length this time, and a measured push from Mills. Everyone was back on the boundary so all the space in the world
length delivery, and Gillespie nudges down to third man for a valuable single. Mills on strike, with one ball to go. A single would do them just fine
a slower ball, clipped into the leg-side deep, and one is the call. That's the ticket for New Zealand
short and a mistimed pull, but it gets Mills off strike ...
outside off stump, and Gillespie's flat-footed poke finds nothing. Ambrose sprints up to the stumps to save the bye
shorter, but arrow-straight. Gillespie defends with a loud "no!"
a swing and a miss again! Outside off, too wide for contact, and now what! A tie is suddenly very much on the agenda ...
a pre-meditated advance from Gillespie, a baseball-slap from Gillespie, who hits his partner!

incredible finish! New Zealand win, but in an unbelievable fashion. Gillespie connected, and the single was a given, but when the shy came in, there was no-one there to back it up! The ball whizzed away for over-throws, and with Daniel Vettori going ballistic on the balcony, there was no stopping them
